reviews.review_msg: Laurie is such a sweet instructor. She explains things in good detail and is accessible outside class. However, her slides have so much content to know and extra reading. All these even appear on tests.

She's an alright lecturer, interesting material. Tests are poorly written, multiple choice with ambiguous/unclear answers. Some questions had errors in them that made them impossible to answer correctly. She sometimes made crazy leaps to connect different cultures and it came across more like forced diversity than anything else. Not a GPA booster.

The quiz images were unrelated to the questions, confusing many students. The TAs were harsh markers and explicitly discouraged grade review requests, stating, "Do not contact me to re-look at your project." Melissa and Deanna sent passive-aggressive emails, making it feel like the professor and TAs were uninterested in student success.

This class is NOT a GPA booster. The prof does nothing except send a few emails here and there (the lectures are recorded by another prof, quizzes are auto-graded and assignments are marked by TAs). The 4 "image" quizzes are very misleading as the image has nothing to do with the question. TAs also mark very harshly for no valid reason.

Professor Nixon-Darcus was great. Because I took this as an online class, the lecture load was heavy, but the quizzes did not require you to know every detail from them. Furthermore, she was very clear on assignment guidelines and even sent out announcements with tips on how to complete them.
